page.title: 08WATER CYCLE IN LOUGHBOROUGH
page.content:
Our water comes from the Derbyshire Peaks. When it rains on to hills it forms streams that flow into the River Dove. The water is collected in a big pipe and it is pumped by Severn Trent Water Authority to a distribution point at the water treatment works to be cleaned. It is then piped to Lough_ borough,Quorn and Leicester.
It now reaches our houses.
Once it is used it is sent to the sewage works to be cleaned again by pipes. The treated water is pumped back into Wood Brook,which runs along to the River Soar,then the River Trent,then the River Humber and finally back to the North Sea.
